org.locationtech.geowave.core.index

Interface CustomIndexStrategy<E,C extends Persistable>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - The entry type (such as SimpleFeature, GridCoverage, or whatever type the adapter uses)
    C - The custom constraints type, can be any arbitrary type, although should be persistable so that it can work outside of just client code (such as server-side filtering, map-reduce, or spark)
    All Superinterfaces:
    Persistable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CustomIndex, TextIndexStrategy

    public interface CustomIndexStrategy<E,C extends Persistable>
extends Persistable
    This interface is the most straightforward mechanism to add custom indexing of any arbitrary logic to a GeoWave data store. This can simply be two functions that tell GeoWave how to index an entry on ingest and how to query the index based on a custom constraints type.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  CustomIndexStrategy.PersistableBiPredicate<E,C extends Persistable> 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default CustomIndexStrategy.PersistableBiPredicate<E,C> getFilter(C constraints)
      Optionally a custom index strategy can enable additional filtering beyond just the query ranges (termed "fine-grained" filtering in documentation).
      InsertionIds getInsertionIds(E entry)
      This is the function that is called on ingest to tell GeoWave how to index the entry within this custom index - the insertion IDs are a set of partition and sort keys, either of which could be empty or null as needed (with the understanding that each partition key represents a unique partition in the backend datastore)
      QueryRanges getQueryRanges(C constraints)
      This is the function that is called on query, when given a query with the constraints type.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.locationtech.geowave.core.index.persist.Persistable

        fromBinary, toBinary

    • Method Detail

      • getInsertionIds

        InsertionIds getInsertionIds(E entry)
        This is the function that is called on ingest to tell GeoWave how to index the entry within this custom index - the insertion IDs are a set of partition and sort keys, either of which could be empty or null as needed (with the understanding that each partition key represents a unique partition in the backend datastore)
        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to be indexed on ingest
        Returns:
        the insertion IDs representing how to index the entry

      • getQueryRanges

        QueryRanges getQueryRanges(C constraints)
        This is the function that is called on query, when given a query with the constraints type. The constraints type can be any arbtitrary type although should be persistable so that it can work outside of just client code (such as server-side filtering, map-reduce, or spark). The query ranges are a set of partition keys and ranges of sort keys that fully include all rows that may match the constraints.
        Parameters:
        constraints - the query constraints
        Returns:
        query ranges that represent valid partition and ranges of sort keys that fully include all rows that may match the constraints

      • getFilter

        default CustomIndexStrategy.PersistableBiPredicate<E,C> getFilter(C constraints)
        Optionally a custom index strategy can enable additional filtering beyond just the query ranges (termed "fine-grained" filtering in documentation). This requires reading rows from disk and evaluating a predicate so it is inherently slower than using query ranges but it is flexible enough to handle any additional evaluation criteria required.
        Returns:
        A predicate that should be used for "fine-grained" filter evaluation
